alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:01PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Duck Creek and it`s tributaries is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 855 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that three quarters to an inch of rain has already fallen. Another quarter to a half inch of rain is expected. Combined with snowmelt, this will cause flooding along Duck Creek. Flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
